Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: lerna
Description: A tool for managing JavaScript projects with multiple packages

Arguments.Name: init
Arguments.Description: Create a new lerna repo or upgrade an existing repo to the current version of Lerna

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: What level of logs to report. On failure, all logs are written to lerna-debug.log in the current working directory

Arguments.Name: --max-buffer
Arguments.Description: Set a max buffer length for each underlying process call

Arguments.Name: --no-progress
Arguments.Description: Disable progress bars. This is always the case in a CI environment

Arguments.Name: --no-sort
Arguments.Description: The --no-sort option disables sorting, instead executing tasks in an arbitrary order with maximum concurrency

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: --npm-client
Arguments.Description: The exececutable to run the script with

Arguments.Name: --exact
Arguments.Description: Set the exact version of lerna in the package.json file

Arguments.Name: bootstrap
Arguments.Description: Bootstrap the packages in the current Lerna repo. Installing all their dependencies and linking any cross-dependencies

Arguments.Name: --scope
Arguments.Description: Include only packages with names matching the given glob

Arguments.Name: --ignore
Arguments.Description: Exclude packages with names matching the given glob

Arguments.Name: --no-private
Arguments.Description: Exclude private packages. They are included by default

Arguments.Name: --since
Arguments.Description: Only include packages that have been changed since the specified ref. If no ref is passed, it defaults to the most-recent tag

Arguments.Name: --exclude-dependents
Arguments.Description: Exclude all transitive dependents when running a command with --since, overriding the default 'changed' algorithm

Arguments.Name: --include-dependents
Arguments.Description: Exclude all transitive dependents when running a command with --since, overriding the default 'changed' algorithm

Arguments.Name: --include-dependencies
Arguments.Description: Include all transitive dependencies when running a command regardless of --scope, --ignore, or --since

Arguments.Name: --include-merged-tags
Arguments.Description: Include tags from merged branches when running a command with --since. This is only useful if you do a lot of publishing from feature branches, which is not generally recommended

Arguments.Name: --npm-client
Arguments.Description: The exececutable to run the script with

Arguments.Name: --hoist
Arguments.Description: Install external dependencies matching glob at the repo root so they're available to all packages

Arguments.Name: --nohoist
Arguments.Description: Do not install external dependencies matching glob at the repo root. This can be used to opt out of hoisting for certain dependencies

Arguments.Name: --strict
Arguments.Description: When used in conjunction with hoist will throw an error and stop bootstrapping after emitting the version warnings. Has no effect if you aren't hoisting, or if there are no version warnings

Arguments.Name: --ignore-prepublish
Arguments.Description: Skip prepublish lifecycle scripts run by default in bootstrapped packages

Arguments.Name: --ignore-scripts
Arguments.Description: Skip any lifecycle scripts normally run (prepare, etc) in bootstrapped packages

Arguments.Name: --registry
Arguments.Description: Forwarded npm commands will use the specified registry for your package(s)

Arguments.Name: --no-ci
Arguments.Description: Disable usage of `npm ci` in CI environments

Arguments.Name: --force-local
Arguments.Description: When passed, this flag causes the bootstrap command to always symlink local dependencies regardless of matching version range

Arguments.Name: import
Arguments.Description: Import the package in the local path <pathToRepo> into packages/<directory-name> with commit history

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: What level of logs to report. On failure, all logs are written to lerna-debug.log in the current working directory

Arguments.Name: --max-buffer
Arguments.Description: Set a max buffer length for each underlying process call

Arguments.Name: --no-progress
Arguments.Description: Disable progress bars. This is always the case in a CI environment

Arguments.Name: --no-sort
Arguments.Description: The --no-sort option disables sorting, instead executing tasks in an arbitrary order with maximum concurrency

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: --flatten
Arguments.Description: Flatten the git history of the repository to import

Arguments.Name: --dest
Arguments.Description: Specify the destination directory by the directory listed in lerna.json

Arguments.Name: --preserve-commit
Arguments.Description: Preserve the original committer and commit date

Arguments.Name: publish
Arguments.Description: Create a new release of the packages that have been updated. Prompts for a new version and updates all the packages on git and npm

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: What level of logs to report. On failure, all logs are written to lerna-debug.log in the current working directory

Arguments.Description: Disable progress bars. This is always the case in a CI environment

Arguments.Name: --no-sort

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: --npm-tag
Arguments.Description: Publish to npm with the given npm dist-tag (Defaults to latest)

Arguments.Name: --force-publish
Arguments.Description: Force publish for the specified packages (comma-separated)

Arguments.Name: --json
Arguments.Description: Show information as a JSON array

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Show parseable output instead of columnified view

Arguments.Name: --toposort
Arguments.Description: Sort packages in topological order (dependencies before dependents) instead of lexical by directory

Arguments.Name: --graph
Arguments.Description: Show dependency graph as a JSON-formatted adjacency list

Arguments.Name: --concurrency

Arguments.Name: --loglevel

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Run an npm script in each package that contains that script

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: What level of logs to report. On failure, all logs are written to lerna-debug.log in the current working directory

Arguments.Name: --max-buffer
Arguments.Description: Set a max buffer length for each underlying process call

Arguments.Name: --no-progress
Arguments.Description: Disable progress bars. This is always the case in a CI environment

Arguments.Name: --no-sort
Arguments.Description: The --no-sort option disables sorting, instead executing tasks in an arbitrary order with maximum concurrency

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: --scope
Arguments.Description: Include only packages with names matching the given glob

Arguments.Name: --ignore
Arguments.Description: Exclude packages with names matching the given glob

Arguments.Name: --no-private
Arguments.Description: Exclude private packages. They are included by default

Arguments.Name: --since
Arguments.Description: Only include packages that have been changed since the specified ref. If no ref is passed, it defaults to the most-recent tag

Arguments.Name: --exclude-dependents
Arguments.Description: Exclude all transitive dependents when running a command with --since, overriding the default 'changed' algorithm

Arguments.Name: --include-dependents
Arguments.Description: Exclude all transitive dependents when running a command with --since, overriding the default 'changed' algorithm

Arguments.Name: --include-dependencies
Arguments.Description: Include all transitive dependencies when running a command regardless of --scope, --ignore, or --since

Arguments.Name: --include-merged-tags
Arguments.Description: Include tags from merged branches when running a command with --since. This is only useful if you do a lot of publishing from feature branches, which is not generally recommended

Arguments.Name: --stream
Arguments.Description: Stream output from child processes immediately, prefixed with the originating package name. This allows output from different packages to be interleaved

Arguments.Name: --parallel
Arguments.Description: Similar to --stream, but completely disregards concurrency and topological sorting, running a given command or script immediately in all matching packages with prefixed streaming output

Arguments.Name: --no-bail
Arguments.Description: By default, lerna run will exit with an error if any script run returns a non-zero exit code. Pass --no-bail to disable this behavior, running the script in all packages that contain it regardless of exit code

Arguments.Name: --no-prefix
Arguments.Description: Disable package name prefixing when output is streaming (--stream or --parallel). This option can be useful when piping results to other processes, such as editor plugins

Arguments.Name: --profile
Arguments.Description: Profiles the script executions and produces a performance profile which can be analyzed using DevTools

Arguments.Name: --profile-location
Arguments.Description: You can provide a custom location for the performance profile output. The path provided will be resolved relative to the current working directory

Arguments.Name: link
Arguments.Description: Symlink together all Lerna packages that are dependencies of each other in the current Lerna repo

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

Arguments.Name: --loglevel
Arguments.Description: What level of logs to report. On failure, all logs are written to lerna-debug.log in the current working directory

Arguments.Name: --max-buffer
Arguments.Description: Set a max buffer length for each underlying process call

Arguments.Name: --no-progress
Arguments.Description: Disable progress bars. This is always the case in a CI environment

Arguments.Name: --no-sort
Arguments.Description: The --no-sort option disables sorting, instead executing tasks in an arbitrary order with maximum concurrency

Arguments.Name: --reject-cycles
Arguments.Description: Fail immediately if a cycle is found (in bootstrap, exec, publish or run)

Arguments.Name: --force-local
Arguments.Description: When passed, this flag causes the link command to always symlink local dependencies regardless of matching version range

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Prints local environment information that proves to be useful especially while submitting bug reports

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Bump version of packages changed since the last release

Arguments.Name: --allow-branch
Arguments.Description: An allowlist of globs that match git branches where lerna version is enabled

Arguments.Name: --amend
Arguments.Description: Perform all changes on the current commit, instead of adding a new one

Arguments.Name: --conventional-commits
Arguments.Description: Use the Conventional Commits Specification to determine the version bump and generate CHANGELOG.md files

Arguments.Name: --conventional-graduate
Arguments.Description: Graduate the specified packages (comma-separated) or all packages using *

Arguments.Name: --conventional-prerelease
Arguments.Description: Release with prerelease versions the specified packages (comma-separated) or all packages using *

Arguments.Name: --create-release
Arguments.Description: Create an official release based on the changes packages

Arguments.Name: --exact
Arguments.Description: Specify updated dependencies in updated packages exactly

Arguments.Name: --force-publish
Arguments.Description: Force publish the specified packages (comma-separated) or all packages using *

Arguments.Name: --git-remote
Arguments.Description: Push the git changes to the specified remote instead of origin

Arguments.Name: --ignore-changes
Arguments.Description: Ignore changes in files matched by glob(s) when detecting changed packages

Arguments.Name: --ignore-scripts
Arguments.Description: Disable running lifecycle scripts during lerna version

Arguments.Name: --include-merged-tags
Arguments.Description: Include tags from merged branches when detecting changed packages

Arguments.Name: -m
Arguments.Description: Use the provided message when committing the version updates for publication

Arguments.Name: --no-changelog
Arguments.Description: When using conventional-commits, do not generate any CHANGELOG.md files

Arguments.Name: --no-git-tag-version
Arguments.Description: Don't commit changes to package.json files and don't tag the release

Arguments.Name: --preid
Arguments.Description: Bump semver using the specified prerelease identifier

Arguments.Name: diff
Arguments.Description: Diff all packages or a single package since the last release

Arguments.Name: exec
Arguments.Description: Execute an arbitrary command in each package

Arguments.Name: --concurrency
Arguments.Description: How many threads to use when Lerna parallelizes the tasks (defaults to count of logical CPU cores)

CustomArgumentTemplates.Name: script
CustomArgumentTemplates.Command:
bash -c lerna list -p | while read p; do
 \cat $p/package.json && echo END
done
